name: The Fool
meaning_upright: The Fool represents new beginnings, having faith in the future, being inexperienced, not knowing what to expect, having beginner's luck, improvisation and believing in the universe. It speaks to taking a leap of faith and trusting the journey ahead.
meaning_reversed: The reversed Fool suggests recklessness, risk-taking, and being taken advantage of. It warns of poor judgment, not looking before you leap, and naivety that has crossed into foolishness rather than wonder.
description: A young man stands at the edge of a cliff, about to step off into the unknown. A small white dog nips at his heels. He carries a small bundle on a stick, representing untapped potential. The sun shines brightly behind him.

name: The Magician
meaning_upright: The Magician signifies that you have all the tools and resources you need to manifest your desires. It is a card of willpower, creation, and turning ideas into reality. The universe is aligned to support your efforts.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Magician warns of manipulation, illusions, and deceit — either from others or self-deception. It can also indicate untapped potential and talents that remain dormant due to lack of confidence or direction.
description: A figure stands before a table bearing the symbols of the four suits — a cup, pentacle, sword, and wand. One hand points to the sky, the other to the earth. An infinity symbol floats above his head. Roses and lilies bloom around him.

name: The High Priestess
meaning_upright: The High Priestess represents deep intuition, mystery, and the subconscious mind. She calls you to look beyond the surface and trust your inner voice. Sacred knowledge is available to you if you quiet your mind and listen.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The High Priestess suggests you are ignoring your intuition or that secrets are being kept. There may be hidden agendas at play, or you may be disconnected from your inner wisdom and relying too heavily on logic alone.
description: A serene woman sits between two pillars — one black (Boaz) and one white (Jachin) — at the entrance to a sacred temple. She wears a crescent moon at her feet and holds a scroll of esoteric wisdom. A veil decorated with pomegranates hangs behind her.

name: The Empress
meaning_upright: The Empress embodies abundance, fertility, and the nurturing power of Mother Nature. She encourages you to connect with beauty, pleasure, and the sensual world. Creative projects flourish under her influence, and material comfort surrounds you.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Empress can indicate creative blocks, dependence on others, or neglecting self-care. You may be smothering someone with attention or experiencing a disconnect from nature and your own nurturing instincts.
description: A regal woman reclines on a cushioned throne surrounded by lush nature. She wears a crown of twelve stars and a robe decorated with pomegranates. A field of golden wheat grows before her, and a heart-shaped shield bearing the symbol of Venus rests beside her.

name: The Emperor
meaning_upright: The Emperor represents authority, structure, and the power of order and discipline. He is the father figure who provides stability and protection. This card calls you to take command of your situation and establish clear boundaries and frameworks.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Emperor warns of excessive control, rigidity, and authoritarian behavior. Power may be misused — either yours or someone else's. It can also suggest a lack of discipline or an inability to take responsibility.
description: A stern figure sits upon a stone throne carved with ram heads, symbols of Aries. He holds an ankh scepter in one hand and an orb in the other. Barren mountains rise behind him, suggesting an unyielding and structured domain.

name: The Hierophant
meaning_upright: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition, and institutions. He is the bridge between heaven and earth, offering guidance through established teachings. This card suggests seeking counsel from a mentor or institution.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Hierophant encourages you to challenge tradition and find your own spiritual path. It suggests that conventional approaches are not serving you, and that it is time to question established norms and think independently.
description: A religious figure sits between two pillars in a formal temple setting. He wears a triple crown and holds a triple cross scepter. Two acolytes kneel before him. Two crossed keys lie at his feet, symbolizing the balance between conscious and subconscious.

name: The Lovers
meaning_upright: The Lovers card represents deep connections, harmony, and meaningful choices about relationships and values. Beyond romance, it speaks to alignment between your inner values and outer actions. A significant decision must be made with both heart and mind.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Lovers indicates disharmony, misalignment of values, or a relationship that has lost its balance. You may be avoiding a difficult choice, or you have made a decision that conflicts with your true self.
description: A man and woman stand beneath the angel Raphael, who blesses them from a cloud above. Behind the woman grows the Tree of Knowledge with the serpent; behind the man stands the Tree of Life with twelve flames. A mountain rises between them.

name: The Chariot
meaning_upright: The Chariot represents determination, willpower, and triumph over obstacles through focused effort. You are in the driver's seat and can harness opposing forces to move forward. Victory is achieved through confidence and unwavering resolve.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Chariot suggests a loss of direction, scattered energy, or aggression. You may be trying to force an outcome rather than finding the right path. Opposing forces feel uncontrollable, and progress stalls.
description: An armored warrior stands in a chariot pulled by one black and one white sphinx. He carries no reins but guides them through sheer willpower. A canopy of stars covers him, and a city wall stands behind him.

name: Strength
meaning_upright: Strength represents inner power, courage, and the ability to overcome challenges through patience and compassion rather than brute force. True strength comes from mastering your own emotions and approaching difficulties with a gentle, steady hand.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, Strength indicates self-doubt, insecurity, and a lack of inner resolve. You may be letting fear or raw emotion control you rather than channeling them constructively. Patience has worn thin and vulnerability feels overwhelming.
description: A woman gently closes the jaws of a lion, symbolizing the taming of primal instincts through love and inner strength. An infinity symbol hovers above her head. She wears a garland of flowers and appears calm and confident.

name: The Hermit
meaning_upright: The Hermit represents a time of introspection, solitude, and inner searching. Like a sage on a mountaintop, you are called to withdraw from the noise of the world to find deeper truth and wisdom within yourself. The answers you seek are found in silence.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Hermit warns of excessive isolation, loneliness, or withdrawal from life. Solitude has become unproductive and may mask a fear of engaging with the world. It is time to reconnect and share your wisdom rather than hoarding it.
description: An old man stands alone at the peak of a snow-capped mountain, holding a lantern containing a six-pointed star. He leans on a staff and gazes downward, illuminating the path for those who follow.

name: Wheel of Fortune
meaning_upright: The Wheel of Fortune signals a turning point driven by fate, luck, and the natural cycles of life. What goes up must come down, and vice versa. This card reminds you that change is the only constant, and the wheel is turning in your favor.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Wheel of Fortune suggests resistance to change, bad luck, or feeling stuck in a negative cycle. External forces seem to work against you. This is a call to examine what patterns you are repeating and where you can break free.
description: A great wheel turns in the sky, inscribed with alchemical symbols and the letters T-A-R-O. A sphinx sits atop the wheel holding a sword, while a serpent descends on the left and Anubis rises on the right.

name: Justice
meaning_upright: Justice represents fairness, truth, and the law of cause and effect. Every action has a consequence, and this card calls for honesty and accountability. Legal matters may be resolved in your favor if you have acted with integrity.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, Justice points to dishonesty, unfairness, or a lack of accountability. The scales are tipped — either someone is being treated unjustly, or you are avoiding the consequences of your own actions. Truth is being obscured.
description: A robed figure sits upon a throne between two pillars, holding a sword upright in the right hand and balanced scales in the left. A purple veil hangs behind, and a small crown adorns the figure's head.

name: The Hanged Man
meaning_upright: The Hanged Man represents voluntary surrender, seeing the world from a new perspective, and the wisdom that comes from letting go. This is not a card of punishment but of enlightenment through stillness. Pause, reflect, and release control.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Hanged Man suggests stalling, unnecessary sacrifice, or resisting the need to let go. You may be clinging to a situation that requires surrender, or you feel stuck in limbo without any spiritual growth coming from the discomfort.
description: A man hangs upside down from a living T-shaped tree, suspended by one foot. His other leg is bent behind the straight one, forming a figure four. A golden halo glows around his head, and his expression is peaceful and contemplative.

name: Death
meaning_upright: Death is a card of profound transformation, endings, and new beginnings. It rarely signifies physical death — instead it marks the end of a chapter so that something new can emerge. Release what no longer serves you and embrace the inevitable cycle of renewal.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, Death indicates resistance to necessary change, stagnation, and clinging to the past. You may be avoiding an ending that is overdue, which only prolongs suffering. Growth cannot happen until you allow the old to fall away.
description: A skeleton in black armor rides a white horse across a field. A king lies fallen, a bishop pleads, and a child and maiden face the rider. A river flows in the background toward two towers, and a black flag with a white rose flutters overhead.

name: Temperance
meaning_upright: Temperance represents balance, moderation, and the art of finding middle ground. Like an alchemist blending elements, you are called to integrate opposing forces in your life with patience and care. Healing and harmony flow from this measured approach.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, Temperance warns of imbalance, excess, and a lack of long-term vision. You may be overindulging, rushing, or swinging between extremes. The remedy lies in slowing down and finding the calm center between opposing pulls.
description: A winged angel stands with one foot on land and one in water, pouring liquid between two golden cups. A path leads from the water to distant mountains where a golden crown hovers between two peaks.

name: The Devil
meaning_upright: The Devil represents bondage, temptation, and the shadow side of human nature. It reveals unhealthy attachments — to material possessions, toxic relationships, or addictive behaviors — that keep you chained. Awareness of these patterns is the first step to liberation.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Devil signals release from bondage and the courage to break free from what has held you captive. You are reclaiming your power and shedding attachments that no longer serve you. It is a hopeful card of liberation and self-awareness.
description: A horned, winged devil figure crouches on a pedestal to which a naked man and woman are loosely chained. The chains are loose enough to remove, suggesting the bondage is self-imposed. An inverted pentagram glows above the devil's head.

name: The Tower
meaning_upright: The Tower represents sudden, dramatic upheaval that shatters existing structures. Lightning strikes and the walls come down. While shocking and often painful, this destruction clears the way for rebuilding on a more honest and solid foundation.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Tower suggests you are resisting or delaying an inevitable collapse. You may be narrowly averting disaster, but the underlying cracks remain. Personal transformation is occurring internally even if the external structures hold for now.
description: A tall stone tower is struck by lightning, its crown blown off in flames. Two figures fall headlong from the burning structure against a dark sky. Twenty-two flames shaped like Hebrew Yods rain down around them.

name: The Star
meaning_upright: The Star is a card of hope, inspiration, and serene renewal after hardship. Following the upheaval of the Tower, the Star promises healing and a renewed sense of purpose. You are guided by a deeper cosmic connection and can trust that brighter days are ahead.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Star indicates a loss of faith, despair, or disconnection from your sense of purpose. The light at the end of the tunnel feels dim. It is a call to reconnect with what inspires you and to trust that hope is not lost, only obscured.
description: A naked woman kneels by a pool of water under a sky full of stars. One large eight-pointed star shines above, surrounded by seven smaller stars. She pours water from two jugs — one onto the land and one into the pool.

name: The Moon
meaning_upright: The Moon represents illusion, fear, and the murky territory of the subconscious. Things are not what they seem, and you must navigate through uncertainty using intuition rather than logic. Hidden truths, dreams, and deep emotions rise to the surface.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Moon brings clarity as illusions dissolve and fears are released. Confusion lifts and the truth is revealed. Anxiety that once felt overwhelming begins to ease as you gain a more accurate understanding of your situation.
description: A full moon with a serene and a stern face shines between two towers. A winding path leads from a pool of water — from which a crayfish emerges — through a landscape guarded by a dog and a wolf.

name: The Sun
meaning_upright: The Sun radiates joy, success, vitality, and the warmth of abundant life. It is one of the most positive cards in the deck, promising happiness, achievement, and the energy to enjoy every moment. Everything is illuminated, and truth and clarity prevail.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The Sun suggests temporary setbacks or that joy is being dampened by self-doubt or overconfidence. The positive energy is still present but partially blocked. It is a gentle reminder to reconnect with simple pleasures and authentic happiness.
description: A radiant sun with a human face shines overhead. A joyful naked child rides a white horse, arms outstretched in celebration. Sunflowers bloom along a stone wall in the background, turning their faces toward the light.

name: Judgement
meaning_upright: Judgement represents a spiritual awakening, a call to rise up and embrace a higher purpose. It is a moment of reckoning — reviewing your past, forgiving yourself and others, and answering an inner calling that demands you become your truest self.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, Judgement indicates self-doubt, refusal to learn from the past, or harsh self-criticism that prevents growth. You may be ignoring an important calling or refusing to take stock of where you have been. Stagnation results from avoiding self-examination.
description: The angel Gabriel blows a great trumpet from the clouds, and figures of men, women, and children rise from coffins with arms outstretched. A vast sea stretches behind them, and snow-covered mountains stand in the distance.

name: The World
meaning_upright: The World represents completion, integration, and the successful conclusion of a major life cycle. You have achieved a significant milestone and can celebrate your accomplishments. All elements of your experience come together in a harmonious whole.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, The World suggests that you are close to completion but something remains unfinished. There is a lack of closure or a feeling of falling short of a goal. It encourages you to tie up loose ends and find what is missing before moving on.
description: A dancing figure is surrounded by a large laurel wreath, holding two wands. Four creatures — angel, eagle, lion, and bull — occupy the four corners, representing the four fixed signs of the zodiac and the four elements.

name: Ace of Wands
meaning_upright: The Ace of Wands heralds a burst of creative energy, inspiration, and the spark of a bold new venture. A powerful opportunity is presenting itself — one that ignites your passion and calls you to act with enthusiasm and confidence.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ace of Wands points to delays, creative blocks, or a promising idea that has lost its momentum. You may be hesitating to act on an inspiration, or the timing is simply not right for this particular spark to catch flame.
description: A hand emerges from a cloud, grasping a living wand from which green leaves sprout. The wand hovers over a lush landscape with a castle in the distance, symbolizing the potential that grows from inspired action.

name: Two of Wands
meaning_upright: The Two of Wands represents planning for the future and making decisions about which path to take. You hold the world in your hands and must choose between the comfort of what you know and the excitement of uncharted territory. Bold vision is favored.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Two of Wands suggests fear of the unknown, poor planning, or playing it too safe. You may be stuck in analysis paralysis, unable to commit to a direction, or reluctant to step outside your comfort zone despite knowing it is time.
description: A man stands on a castle battlement, holding a globe in one hand and a wand in the other. A second wand is fixed to the wall beside him. He gazes out over the sea toward distant mountains, contemplating his next move.

name: Three of Wands
meaning_upright: The Three of Wands signals expansion, progress, and the rewards of foresight and planning. Your ships are coming in — ventures you set in motion are bearing fruit. The world is opening up with new opportunities and your vision is beginning to materialize.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Three of Wands indicates delays, obstacles to your plans, or frustration when expected results fail to materialize. Ventures abroad or long-term projects may hit snags. It is a call to reassess your strategy and remain patient.
description: A figure stands on a cliff overlooking the sea, watching three ships sail toward the horizon. Three wands are planted in the ground beside him. The golden cloak and confident posture suggest someone whose plans are well underway.

name: Four of Wands
meaning_upright: The Four of Wands is a card of celebration, joy, and the achievement of an important milestone. It often signals a homecoming, a wedding, or a moment of communal harmony where hard work is recognized and celebrated. Stability and happiness abound.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Four of Wands suggests tension within the home or community, a lack of support, or a celebration that feels hollow. A milestone may be delayed or overshadowed by underlying conflict. It calls for addressing what disrupts your sense of belonging.
description: Four wands form a decorated canopy adorned with garlands and flowers. Two figures dance joyfully in the foreground while a welcoming castle or estate stands in the background. The scene radiates festivity and communal celebration.

name: Five of Wands
meaning_upright: The Five of Wands represents competition, conflict, and the clash of differing opinions. Multiple forces vie for dominance, creating tension and struggle. This is not destructive conflict — it is the creative friction that pushes everyone to sharpen their skills.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Five of Wands suggests avoidance of necessary conflict, inner turmoil, or the resolution of a dispute. You may be shying away from healthy competition, or a previously chaotic situation is finally finding compromise and common ground.
description: Five young men brandish wands against each other in what appears to be a chaotic skirmish. Their combat seems more like a spirited contest than a battle — no one appears wounded. The ground beneath them is uneven and bare.

name: Six of Wands
meaning_upright: The Six of Wands signals victory, public recognition, and the triumphant completion of a challenge. You have earned the respect and admiration of those around you. Confidence is high, and others look to you as a leader and achiever.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Six of Wands warns of egotism, a fall from grace, or achievements that go unrecognized. Success may have inflated your ego, or you are not receiving the acknowledgment you deserve. It counsels humility and internal validation.
description: A horseman rides through a crowd, holding a wand adorned with a laurel wreath of victory. Five other wands are raised by the crowd in celebration. The rider's posture is proud and confident as people cheer around him.

name: Seven of Wands
meaning_upright: The Seven of Wands represents perseverance, defending your position, and standing your ground against opposition. You have the higher ground and the advantage, but must continue to fight for what you believe in. Challenges test your resolve but you are equipped to prevail.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Seven of Wands suggests feeling overwhelmed by opposition, exhaustion from constant fighting, or the temptation to give up. Your defenses are weakening and it may be time to reconsider whether this battle is worth the energy it demands.
description: A man stands on a hilltop, defending his position against six wands thrust upward from below. He holds a seventh wand and wears mismatched shoes, suggesting he was caught off guard but is fighting valiantly nonetheless.

name: Eight of Wands
meaning_upright: The Eight of Wands signals swift action, rapid progress, and powerful forward momentum. Events accelerate and things fall into place quickly. Communication flows freely, travel is favored, and obstacles that once blocked your path have cleared.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Eight of Wands warns of delays, miscommunications, or scattered energy that disrupts progress. Things that should be moving forward are stalled. Patience is needed as the momentum you expected has temporarily been redirected.
description: Eight wands fly through the air at great speed over a clear landscape with a river below. No human figure appears — the card is pure motion and energy, suggesting that events are in flight and will land soon.

name: Nine of Wands
meaning_upright: The Nine of Wands represents resilience, courage, and persistence in the face of adversity. Though battle-worn and weary, you refuse to give up. One final test remains, and you have the strength to see it through. Guard your boundaries and trust your experience.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Nine of Wands indicates total exhaustion, excessive defensiveness, or stubborn resistance to necessary change. You may be seeing threats where none exist or refusing to lower your walls even when the danger has passed.
description: A bandaged, weary man leans on a wand and looks warily behind him at a wall of eight upright wands. Despite his injuries, he stands firm and alert, ready to face whatever comes next. His expression shows determination mixed with fatigue.

name: Ten of Wands
meaning_upright: The Ten of Wands represents carrying a heavy burden, being overworked, and taking on too many responsibilities. Success has come at a cost — the weight of your achievements and obligations is becoming unsustainable. It is time to delegate or set down what you can.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ten of Wands signals relief from burdens, the act of delegation, or the collapse that comes from carrying too much for too long. You are learning to let go of unnecessary responsibilities and prioritize what truly matters.
description: A man struggles to carry ten heavy wands toward a distant town. His back is bent under the weight and his face is hidden by the bundle. Though the destination is in sight, the journey is arduous and his grip uncertain.

name: Page of Wands
meaning_upright: The Page of Wands is a messenger of inspiration, bringing news of exciting opportunities and creative ventures. This card embodies youthful enthusiasm, a desire to explore, and the courage to pursue your passions without reservation.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Page of Wands suggests immaturity, a lack of direction, or creative ideas that fizzle before they gain traction. Enthusiasm without follow-through leads to wasted potential. It warns against making hasty decisions based on fleeting excitement.
description: A young person stands in a barren landscape, holding a wand and gazing at it with fascination and wonder. Salamanders decorate the tunic — symbols of fire and transformation. The figure's expression is bright and eager, ready for adventure.

name: Knight of Wands
meaning_upright: The Knight of Wands charges forward with passion, fearlessness, and an unquenchable thirst for adventure. This card represents bold action, travel, and pursuing your goals with intense energy. The knight does not hesitate — he acts on his vision immediately.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Knight of Wands warns of reckless behavior, haste without thought, and energy scattered across too many pursuits. Plans may unravel due to impulsiveness. It counsels channeling your fire more deliberately rather than burning in every direction.
description: An armored knight charges forward on a rearing horse, holding a budding wand high. His cloak and the horse's caparison are decorated with salamanders. Three pyramids stand in the desert background, and the knight's visor is raised.

name: Queen of Wands
meaning_upright: The Queen of Wands embodies confidence, warmth, and fierce independence. She is socially magnetic, creatively inspired, and determined to succeed on her own terms. This card encourages you to own your power and lead with passion and generosity.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Queen of Wands suggests jealousy, selfishness, or insecurity hidden behind a bold facade. Confidence may have tipped into arrogance, or you are comparing yourself unfavorably to others. It calls for honest self-reflection and genuine warmth.
description: A confident queen sits on a throne decorated with lions and sunflowers, holding a wand in one hand and a sunflower in the other. A black cat sits at her feet. Her expression is warm yet commanding, and her yellow robe suggests vitality and joy.

name: King of Wands
meaning_upright: The King of Wands is a natural-born leader who inspires others through his bold vision, honor, and entrepreneurial spirit. He turns ideas into empires and leads by example. This card calls you to step into a leadership role with courage, creativity, and integrity.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the King of Wands warns of an overbearing leader, unrealistic expectations, or ruthless ambition that disregards others. Power may be wielded impulsively or selfishly. It counsels tempering your fire with wisdom and consideration for those you lead.
description: A king sits upon a throne adorned with lions and salamanders, holding a living wand that sprouts leaves. A small salamander sits at his feet. His crown is prominent and his gaze is forward-looking, embodying visionary leadership and creative authority.

name: Ace of Cups
meaning_upright: The Ace of Cups overflows with new love, emotional beginnings, and the opening of the heart. A powerful wave of compassion, creativity, or spiritual connection is entering your life. Be open to receiving this gift with gratitude and vulnerability.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ace of Cups suggests emotional blockages, repressed feelings, or a missed opportunity for love and connection. Your cup may feel empty or you are unwilling to open your heart. It calls for emotional honesty and releasing what holds you back.
description: A hand emerges from a cloud, holding a golden chalice overflowing with five streams of water. A dove descends into the cup carrying a communion wafer. Water lilies float on the surface of the sea below.

name: Two of Cups
meaning_upright: The Two of Cups celebrates a deep, reciprocal connection between two people. It represents partnership, mutual attraction, and the harmonious union of two souls. Whether romantic, platonic, or professional, this bond is built on respect and genuine affection.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Two of Cups points to imbalance in a relationship, broken trust, or a partnership that has lost its harmony. Miscommunication and unmet expectations create tension. It is a call to address the disconnect honestly before it deepens.
description: A young man and woman face each other, each holding a golden cup. Above them rises a caduceus with a winged lion's head — a symbol of healing and passion. Their exchange of cups suggests a pledge or partnership being formed.

name: Three of Cups
meaning_upright: The Three of Cups is a card of celebration, friendship, and communal joy. It marks a time of coming together with loved ones to share in life's blessings. Creative collaborations thrive, and the bonds of friendship deepen through shared experience.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Three of Cups warns of overindulgence, gossip, or feeling excluded from a social group. Celebrations may feel superficial or friendships may turn sour. It counsels discernment about who you celebrate with and moderation in festivities.
description: Three women dance in a circle, raising their cups in a toast. Garlands of flowers surround them and fruits and vegetables lie at their feet, symbolizing abundance. Their expressions are joyful and their bond appears genuine and warm.

name: Four of Cups
meaning_upright: The Four of Cups represents apathy, contemplation, and dissatisfaction with what is being offered. You may be so lost in introspection or discontent that you fail to notice a new opportunity right in front of you. It is time to reassess what truly matters.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Four of Cups signals a renewed awareness and willingness to engage. The fog of apathy lifts and you begin to see the opportunities that have been waiting for you. Motivation returns as you shift from introspection to action.
description: A young man sits beneath a tree with arms crossed, staring at three cups on the ground before him. A mysterious hand extends from a cloud, offering a fourth cup, but he does not notice it. His expression is one of boredom or deep thought.

name: Five of Cups
meaning_upright: The Five of Cups speaks of grief, loss, and the pain of focusing on what has been spilled rather than what remains. Disappointment and regret dominate your emotional landscape. While the pain is real, this card gently reminds you that not all is lost.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Five of Cups signals acceptance, recovery, and the willingness to move on from grief. You are beginning to turn around and notice the cups still standing. Healing is underway, and you are finding peace with what cannot be changed.
description: A cloaked figure stands in sorrow, looking down at three overturned cups whose contents have spilled. Behind the figure, two cups remain upright and full. A bridge in the distance leads to a small village, suggesting a path forward.

name: Six of Cups
meaning_upright: The Six of Cups evokes nostalgia, childhood innocence, and the sweetness of happy memories. It can signal a reunion with someone from your past or a return to simpler times. Generosity and kindness flow freely, and comfort is found in familiar places.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Six of Cups warns of being stuck in the past, viewing things through rose-colored glasses, or clinging to outdated relationships and patterns. Nostalgia has become an escape from present reality. It is time to embrace the here and now.
description: In a courtyard of an old estate, a young boy offers a cup filled with flowers to a younger girl. Five more cups filled with flowers stand nearby. The scene is quaint and safe, evoking the warmth and simplicity of childhood.

name: Seven of Cups
meaning_upright: The Seven of Cups presents a dizzying array of options, fantasies, and temptations — not all of which are what they seem. Wishful thinking and illusion cloud your judgment. This card calls for discernment: which of these visions is real and worth pursuing?
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Seven of Cups brings clarity and focus. The fog of fantasy lifts and you can see your options clearly. It is time to stop daydreaming and make a grounded, deliberate choice. Reality replaces illusion and your path becomes evident.
description: A silhouetted figure stands before seven cups floating in clouds, each containing a different vision — a castle, jewels, a wreath, a dragon, a veiled figure, a glowing figure, and a snake. The offerings are enticing but ephemeral, shrouded in mist.

name: Eight of Cups
meaning_upright: The Eight of Cups represents the courageous decision to walk away from something that no longer fulfills you, even when it looks good on the surface. You are seeking deeper meaning and are willing to leave behind comfort in pursuit of greater truth.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Eight of Cups indicates fear of leaving, clinging to what is familiar despite unhappiness, or avoiding a necessary departure. You know in your heart that something is missing but are not yet ready to make the difficult choice to move on.
description: A cloaked figure walks away from eight neatly stacked cups under a moonlit sky. The figure heads toward barren mountains, leaving behind what appears to be a complete set. An eclipsed moon hangs overhead, casting an eerie but guiding light.

name: Nine of Cups
meaning_upright: The Nine of Cups is known as the wish card — a sign that your heart's desires are within reach. Deep contentment, emotional satisfaction, and a sense of personal achievement fill your life. Gratitude amplifies the abundance already present.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Nine of Cups warns of greed, shallow satisfaction, or wishes fulfilled that leave you feeling empty. Material comfort does not equal emotional fulfillment. It calls for examining whether your desires align with your deeper values.
description: A well-dressed man sits contentedly before an arched display of nine golden cups, arms crossed and expression satisfied. The cups are arranged neatly behind him like trophies, symbolizing wishes granted and emotional abundance.

name: Ten of Cups
meaning_upright: The Ten of Cups represents the ultimate emotional fulfillment — love, family, harmony, and lasting happiness. It is the fairy-tale ending where all relationships are in alignment and joy permeates every aspect of your life. Gratitude for these blessings is the key.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ten of Cups points to family discord, broken relationships, or a home life that falls short of the ideal. The outward appearance of happiness may mask deeper dysfunction. It calls for honest work on the relationships that matter most.
description: A joyful couple stands arm in arm, gesturing toward a rainbow of ten cups arching across the sky. Two children dance and play nearby. A charming cottage and flowing river complete the idyllic scene of domestic bliss and emotional fulfillment.

name: Page of Cups
meaning_upright: The Page of Cups brings a message from the heart — an unexpected creative idea, an intuitive flash, or a new emotional experience that stirs your soul. This card embodies the wonder of a child discovering the richness of their inner world for the first time.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Page of Cups suggests emotional immaturity, creative blocks, or retreating into fantasy rather than dealing with real feelings. There may be an inability to express emotions constructively, leading to moodiness or escapist tendencies.
description: A young person in elaborate attire stands by the sea, holding a golden cup from which a small fish pops out, surprising and delighting them. The figure's expression is one of wonder and openness. Waves lap gently at the shore behind.

name: Knight of Cups
meaning_upright: The Knight of Cups is the romantic dreamer who follows his heart above all else. He arrives bearing emotional proposals, creative invitations, or declarations of love. This card encourages you to let your emotions guide you toward beauty, art, and meaningful connection.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Knight of Cups warns of moodiness, unrealistic expectations, and emotional manipulation. Romance or creative pursuit may be driven by fantasy rather than genuine feeling. It counsels grounding your idealism in reality.
description: A knight in shining armor rides a calm white horse across a serene landscape, holding a golden cup before him like an offering. His winged helmet and flowing cloak suggest a messenger of emotion. A river winds through the peaceful backdrop.

name: Queen of Cups
meaning_upright: The Queen of Cups is the embodiment of emotional intelligence, deep compassion, and intuitive wisdom. She feels deeply and nurtures those around her with empathy and care. This card encourages trusting your emotional instincts and offering support from a place of genuine love.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Queen of Cups warns of codependency, emotional manipulation, or losing yourself in others' needs. Compassion has crossed into martyrdom, and boundaries have dissolved. It calls for reclaiming your emotional center and caring for yourself first.
description: A contemplative queen sits on a stone throne at the edge of the sea, holding an ornate covered chalice and gazing at it intently. Cherubs and sea creatures adorn her throne. Her feet rest on colorful pebbles at the water's edge.

name: King of Cups
meaning_upright: The King of Cups represents mastery over the emotional realm — balance, diplomacy, and the ability to navigate complex feelings with wisdom and grace. He is generous, kind, and fair, offering counsel and comfort without being overwhelmed by emotion.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the King of Cups suggests emotional volatility, manipulation, or coldness disguised as composure. Emotional control has become suppression, and feelings may erupt in unpredictable ways. It warns against using emotional intelligence as a tool for control.
description: A king sits on a stone throne amid a turbulent sea, yet remains calm and composed. He holds a cup in his right hand and a short scepter in his left. A ship sails on the choppy waters behind him and a leaping fish appears at his right.

name: Ace of Swords
meaning_upright: The Ace of Swords cuts through confusion with the sharp blade of clarity and truth. A powerful new idea, breakthrough, or moment of mental clarity arrives. Justice and truth prevail, and your mind is sharp enough to see through deception.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ace of Swords warns of confusion, misinformation, and clouded judgment. A breakthrough that seemed imminent is blocked by mental fog or deceit. It counsels against making important decisions until clarity is restored.
description: A hand emerges from a cloud, grasping an upright sword crowned with a golden crown from which a laurel and palm branch hang. Six Yods fall around the blade. Jagged mountains rise beneath, suggesting the piercing nature of truth.

name: Two of Swords
meaning_upright: The Two of Swords represents a difficult decision, a stalemate, or the avoidance of an uncomfortable truth. You feel torn between two options and have closed off your emotions to cope. The blindfold must come off — clarity requires facing what you have been avoiding.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Two of Swords suggests being overwhelmed by information, forced to choose between bad options, or finally confronting a decision you have been avoiding. The stalemate breaks, but the resolution may not be comfortable.
description: A blindfolded woman sits on a stone bench by the sea, holding two crossed swords over her heart. A crescent moon hangs in the sky behind her. Rocks jut from the water, suggesting hidden obstacles.

name: Three of Swords
meaning_upright: The Three of Swords represents heartbreak, emotional pain, and the sorrow that comes from a painful truth. A betrayal, loss, or hurtful revelation pierces the heart. While the grief is acute, acknowledging the pain is the first step toward healing.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Three of Swords signals the beginning of recovery from heartbreak. The worst of the pain is passing, and you are finding the strength to forgive and release. Optimism slowly returns as the wounds begin to close.
description: Three swords pierce a bright red heart against a backdrop of heavy grey rain clouds. The image is stark and unmistakable — pure emotional pain without embellishment. Rain falls steadily, representing tears and the cleansing nature of grief.

name: Four of Swords
meaning_upright: The Four of Swords prescribes rest, recovery, and a retreat from the battles of life. After the pain of the Three, healing requires stillness and solitude. Step back from the fray to restore your mental and physical energy before the next challenge.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Four of Swords suggests restlessness, burnout, or being forced into recovery by illness or circumstance. You may be resisting the rest you desperately need, or a period of stagnation has overstayed its welcome and it is time to reengage.
description: A knight lies in repose upon a stone tomb in a church or chapel, hands clasped in prayer. Three swords hang on the wall above, and one lies beneath the tomb. A stained-glass window suggests sanctuary and divine rest.

name: Five of Swords
meaning_upright: The Five of Swords represents conflict, defeat, and the aftermath of a battle where nobody truly wins. A victory achieved through deception or cruelty is hollow. This card warns that winning at all costs damages relationships and leaves lingering resentment.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Five of Swords signals reconciliation, the desire to make amends, and moving past old conflicts. The weapons are laid down and former adversaries seek peace. It encourages letting go of the need to be right in favor of harmony.
description: A smirking figure holds three swords while two others lie on the ground. Two defeated opponents walk away in the background, heads bowed. The sky is cloudy and turbulent. The scene feels hollow and isolating.

name: Six of Swords
meaning_upright: The Six of Swords represents a necessary transition — moving away from turbulence toward calmer waters. Though the journey is tinged with sadness for what is left behind, it leads to a better place. Sometimes the bravest thing is to simply move on.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Six of Swords suggests difficulty moving on, unfinished business, or emotional baggage that weighs down your journey. You may be resisting a necessary transition or unable to leave a troubled situation despite knowing you should.
description: A hooded figure sits in a boat with a child, being ferried across water by a boatman. Six swords stand upright in the bow of the boat. The water is choppy on one side and calm on the other, symbolizing the transition from difficulty to peace.

name: Seven of Swords
meaning_upright: The Seven of Swords represents deception, cunning strategy, and getting away with something. Someone is acting covertly — either you or someone around you. This card warns of dishonesty and encourages examining where shortcuts or deception may be at play in your life.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Seven of Swords suggests that deception is being uncovered, a guilty conscience is gnawing, or someone is coming clean about a lie. The truth is surfacing and it is time to face the consequences honestly rather than continue the charade.
description: A figure sneaks away from a military camp carrying five swords, leaving two behind. He glances back over his shoulder with a sly expression. Yellow tents stand in the background and the ground appears sandy and open.

name: Eight of Swords
meaning_upright: The Eight of Swords represents feeling trapped, restricted, and powerless — but the imprisonment is largely self-imposed. Fear and limiting beliefs have blindfolded you to the escape routes that exist. The bindings are loose; you can free yourself when you choose to see clearly.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Eight of Swords signals a breakthrough from self-imposed limitations. The blindfold is coming off and you begin to see options you could not perceive before. Empowerment replaces helplessness as you reclaim your agency.
description: A blindfolded and loosely bound woman stands surrounded by eight swords stuck in the muddy ground. Water pools around her feet and a castle stands on a cliff in the distance. Despite her apparent captivity, the bonds are clearly loose enough to escape.

name: Nine of Swords
meaning_upright: The Nine of Swords is the card of anxiety, insomnia, and anguish that strikes in the dark of night. Worries and fears feel overwhelming and inescapable. While the suffering is real, this card often indicates that the situation is not as dire as it appears — fear magnifies the threat.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Nine of Swords signals that the worst of the anxiety is passing. You are beginning to see your fears in perspective, reaching out for help, or finding the courage to address the root causes of your worry. Dawn is approaching.
description: A person sits upright in bed, face buried in hands, clearly distraught from a nightmare. Nine swords hang horizontally on the dark wall behind them. The bedspread is decorated with roses and a combat scene, suggesting the nature of the torment.

name: Ten of Swords
meaning_upright: The Ten of Swords marks the painful end of a cycle — rock bottom, betrayal, or a devastating loss. There is no sugar-coating this moment. However, because this is the final sword, the worst is over. The only direction from here is up. A new dawn is breaking.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ten of Swords signals that you are beginning to recover from a devastating blow. You refuse to stay down and are pulling the swords from your back one by one. Alternatively, you may be resisting an ending that has already occurred.
description: A figure lies face down on the ground with ten swords plunged into their back. The sky is black above but a golden dawn breaks on the horizon. Calm water stretches in the background. The sunrise promises that this ending heralds a new beginning.

name: Page of Swords
meaning_upright: The Page of Swords is a sharp-minded, curious messenger who brings new ideas and intellectual challenges. This card embodies mental agility, a thirst for knowledge, and the vigilance of someone always ready to engage with the truth, no matter how uncomfortable.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Page of Swords warns of gossip, jumping to conclusions, or using intelligence destructively. Mental energy is scattered or directed toward cynicism rather than constructive inquiry. Words may be wielded carelessly, causing unintended harm.
description: A young figure stands on uneven ground, holding a sword upright with both hands and looking alertly to the side. Wind blows through the trees and clouds scud across the sky. Birds fly in the distance. The figure's stance is eager and vigilant.

name: Knight of Swords
meaning_upright: The Knight of Swords charges into battle with fierce determination and single-minded ambition. He is swift, decisive, and unstoppable when focused on a goal. This card encourages bold, decisive action and cutting through obstacles with the power of intellect and will.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Knight of Swords warns of reckless haste, burnout from overextension, or aggression without direction. Speed without strategy leads to mistakes. It counsels slowing down, thinking before acting, and ensuring your charge has a worthy destination.
description: An armored knight charges forward on a galloping horse, sword raised high and ready to strike. Wind-torn clouds and bent trees show the speed of his approach. Butterflies decorate the horse's bridle, and birds scatter before the knight's path.

name: Queen of Swords
meaning_upright: The Queen of Swords is a paragon of clear thinking, honest communication, and intellectual independence. She cuts through illusion with precision and speaks truth without apology. This card encourages you to approach situations with clear eyes and a discerning mind.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Queen of Swords warns of coldness, cruelty, or bitterness that masquerades as honesty. The sharp mind has become a weapon, and criticism has crossed into harshness. It calls for tempering intellect with empathy.
description: A stern queen sits on a stone throne high among the clouds, holding a sword upright in her right hand. Her left hand reaches out as if beckoning truth. A single butterfly hovers near her crown. Her expression is shrewd and uncompromising.

name: King of Swords
meaning_upright: The King of Swords represents intellectual authority, ethical leadership, and the fair application of truth and justice. He makes decisions based on logic and principle rather than emotion. This card calls you to lead with integrity, clarity, and an unwavering commitment to what is right.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the King of Swords warns of an abuse of intellectual power — manipulation, tyranny, or cold rationality that disregards human feeling. Authority may be wielded without compassion, and truth may be twisted to serve selfish ends.
description: A king sits upon a throne adorned with butterflies and crescent moons, holding a sword upright in his right hand. Trees bend in the wind behind him and clouds gather in the sky. His expression is stern but fair.

name: Ace of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Ace of Pentacles represents a golden opportunity for material prosperity, a promising new venture, or the seed of lasting financial stability. The universe is offering you a tangible gift — a job, investment, or resource. Seize it with both hands and nurture it wisely.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ace of Pentacles warns of a missed opportunity, poor financial planning, or instability in material matters. A promising venture may fall through due to lack of preparation, or you may be so focused on scarcity that you cannot see the abundance before you.
description: A hand emerges from a cloud, holding a golden pentacle over a lush garden. An archway of flowering hedges leads to distant mountains. The path is clear and inviting, symbolizing the open door to material abundance.

name: Two of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Two of Pentacles represents the art of balancing multiple priorities with grace and adaptability. You are juggling responsibilities — finances, work, relationships — and managing to keep everything in motion. Flexibility and a sense of humor are your greatest assets now.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Two of Pentacles warns of overwhelm, dropped balls, and overextension. You have taken on too much and the juggling act is faltering. It is time to reassess priorities, simplify, and focus on what matters most before everything crashes.
description: A young man dances while juggling two pentacles connected by an infinity-shaped ribbon. Behind him, two ships ride enormous waves on a turbulent sea. Despite the chaos, his expression is playful and his balance seems effortless.

name: Three of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Three of Pentacles celebrates teamwork, skilled craftsmanship, and the power of collaboration. A project requires the combined talents of multiple people, each contributing their expertise. Recognition comes to those who take pride in the quality of their work.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Three of Pentacles points to poor teamwork, lack of effort, or work that falls short of its potential. Collaborators may be out of sync, or individual contributions are mediocre. It calls for higher standards and better communication among team members.
description: A stonemason works on the interior of a cathedral while a monk and an architect consult blueprints beside him. Three pentacles are carved into the archway above. The scene represents the synthesis of vision, skill, and spiritual purpose.

name: Four of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Four of Pentacles represents a strong desire for security, control, and the conservation of resources. You are holding tightly to what you have, whether money, possessions, or power. While prudent saving has its place, excessive clinging creates stagnation and isolation.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Four of Pentacles signals either reckless spending and financial insecurity, or the positive release of material attachment. You may be learning to let go of control and be more generous, or conversely, losing grip on your financial stability.
description: A man sits on a stone bench outside a city, clutching a pentacle to his chest. One pentacle sits atop his crown, and two more are locked beneath his feet. His posture is closed and guarded.

name: Five of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Five of Pentacles represents financial hardship, poverty, and the feeling of being left out in the cold. Material loss and struggle weigh heavily, and you may feel isolated in your difficulty. Yet help is often closer than it appears — the lit window of the church goes unnoticed.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Five of Pentacles signals recovery from hardship, the discovery of help and charity, or a financial situation that begins to improve. You are turning a corner and finding the support — material or spiritual — that was there all along.
description: Two destitute figures trudge through snow past the stained-glass window of a church. One walks on crutches, the other is barefoot and wrapped in a thin shawl. Five pentacles glow in the illuminated window above.

name: Six of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Six of Pentacles represents generosity, the sharing of wealth, and the balance between giving and receiving. Whether you are the giver or the receiver, this card speaks to the flow of resources and the importance of gratitude and fairness in material exchanges.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Six of Pentacles warns of generosity with strings attached, unhealthy power dynamics around money, or debts that create obligation rather than genuine giving. It calls for examining the true motives behind acts of charity and financial exchange.
description: A wealthy merchant holds balanced scales in one hand while distributing coins to two kneeling beggars with the other. Six pentacles float above the scene. The scales suggest fairness, but the power dynamic is unmistakable.

name: Seven of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Seven of Pentacles represents patience, assessment, and the long wait for investments to bear fruit. You have planted seeds and tended them diligently — now is a time to step back, evaluate your progress, and trust that your efforts will yield results in due time.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Seven of Pentacles suggests impatience, wasted effort, or investments that are not yielding the expected returns. You may be questioning whether your hard work has been worthwhile or considering abandoning a project that seems to be going nowhere.
description: A farmer leans on his hoe, gazing thoughtfully at a bush bearing seven golden pentacles. His expression is contemplative — assessing whether the harvest will justify the labor. Green leaves surround the pentacles, suggesting growth still in progress.

name: Eight of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Eight of Pentacles celebrates dedicated craftsmanship, skill development, and the pursuit of mastery through diligent practice. You are committed to honing your craft and producing quality work. This focused effort will lead to expertise and material reward.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Eight of Pentacles warns of perfectionism that paralyzes, lack of motivation, or work that has become tedious and unfulfilling. You may be going through the motions without genuine engagement or cutting corners on quality.
description: A craftsman sits at a workbench, carefully carving a pentacle. Six completed pentacles hang on display to his left, and one sits at his feet. A small town lies in the background, but he is completely absorbed in his work.

name: Nine of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Nine of Pentacles represents well-earned abundance, luxury, and the rewards of self-sufficiency. Through discipline and hard work, you have achieved financial independence and can now enjoy the finer things in life. You are surrounded by beauty of your own making.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Nine of Pentacles warns of overworking at the expense of enjoyment, superficial displays of wealth, or a financial setback that threatens your comfort. The abundance may be hollow if it was achieved through shortcuts or at the cost of personal relationships.
description: An elegant woman stands in a lush vineyard, a hooded falcon perched on her gloved hand. Nine pentacles hang from the abundant vines around her. A large estate is visible in the background. Her silk robes speak of refined comfort.

name: Ten of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Ten of Pentacles represents lasting wealth, family legacy, and the culmination of material success across generations. Financial stability is not just for you but extends to your family and community. It speaks to the satisfaction of building something that endures.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Ten of Pentacles warns of family disputes over money, squandered inheritance, or financial instability that threatens a legacy. Wealth may divide rather than unite, and the foundations of long-term security may be crumbling due to poor stewardship.
description: An elderly patriarch sits beneath an archway decorated with ten pentacles arranged in the Tree of Life pattern. A young couple and a child stand nearby, and two dogs play at the old man's feet. A grand estate rises behind them.

name: Page of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Page of Pentacles is an earnest, studious messenger who brings news of a new financial or educational opportunity. This card embodies the beginner's mindset applied to practical matters — diligent study, careful planning, and the first steps toward manifesting a tangible goal.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Page of Pentacles warns of procrastination, lack of progress, or a promising opportunity that slips away due to inaction. Practical dreams remain ungrounded, and the discipline needed to bring them to fruition is lacking.
description: A young figure stands in a green field, holding a single pentacle up and gazing at it with deep concentration and wonder. Plowed fields and distant mountains stretch behind, symbolizing the fertile ground available for those willing to do the work.

name: Knight of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Knight of Pentacles is the most dependable and methodical of all the knights. He moves slowly but surely, committed to seeing every task through to completion with thoroughness and reliability. This card encourages steady progress, patience, and unwavering commitment to your work.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Knight of Pentacles warns of stagnation, laziness, or an overly cautious approach that prevents progress. Routine has become rut, and methodical behavior has turned into stubbornness. It is time to shake things up and take a calculated risk.
description: A knight sits motionless on a heavy draft horse, holding a single pentacle and surveying plowed fields. Unlike the other knights, he is completely still — patient, grounded, and unhurried.

name: Queen of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The Queen of Pentacles embodies practical nurturing, material abundance, and the ability to create a warm, secure home life while managing worldly affairs. She is resourceful, generous, and grounded — a master of balancing care for others with financial prudence.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the Queen of Pentacles warns of neglecting home life for work, smothering loved ones with material excess, or financial insecurity that undermines your sense of safety. The balance between nurturing and practical matters has been lost.
description: A queen sits on a throne adorned with carved fruit and goat heads, cradling a golden pentacle in her lap. Roses climb the archway behind her, a rabbit hops in the foreground, and a lush garden surrounds her.

name: King of Pentacles
meaning_upright: The King of Pentacles represents the pinnacle of material success, business acumen, and financial mastery. He has built his wealth through discipline, patience, and shrewd decision-making. This card encourages you to embody responsible stewardship and enjoy the fruits of your labors.
meaning_reversed: Reversed, the King of Pentacles warns of greed, corruption, or financial mismanagement. Wealth has become an end in itself rather than a tool for good. Materialism may be consuming your values, or poor business decisions threaten what you have built.
description: A prosperous king sits upon an ornate throne decorated with bull heads, surrounded by grapevines and lush vegetation. He holds a golden pentacle in one hand and a scepter in the other. His castle rises behind him.
